title: Ali Kurumahmut
text:
Ali Kurumahmut (born October 1, 1960) is a Turkish <a href="bureaucrat">bureaucrat</a>, lecturer, <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a>, and former member of <a href="Turkish%20Council%20of%20State">Council of State (Turkey)</a>.
Early life and career.
Ali Kurumahmut was born in <a href="Of%2C%20Turkey">Of</a>, <a href="Trabzon%20Province">Trabzon Province</a>, Turkey. He graduated from <a href="Naval%20Academy%20%28Turkey%29">Naval Academy</a>, Istanbul in 1982. In 1995, he graduated from <a href="Istanbul%20University">Istanbul University Law Faculty</a>. He holds a master's degree in International Law from <a href="Marmara%20University">Marmara University</a>. Following years he completed the Staff Academy and the <a href="Turkish%20War%20Academies">Armed Forces Academy</a>. He left the Navy when he was a staff colonel in 2002.
He took an active role in the management of <a href="Imia/Kardak">Kardak (Imia) crisis</a>.
He served as General Director of Maritime Transportation at the Undersecreteriat of Maritime Affairs, <a href="Ministry%20of%20Transportation%20%28Turkey%29">Ministry of Transportation</a> from 18 July 2003 to 17 October 2005. From 2005 to 2013, he acted as advisor to some members of the <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Turkey">cabinet</a> and lectured in the <a href="Turkish%20War%20Academies">Turkish War Academies</a>.
Kurumahmut was appointed as justice to <a href="Turkish%20Council%20of%20State">Turkish Council of State</a> 8th Chamber in 2013 by President <a href="Abdullah%20G%C3%BCl">Abdullah Gül</a>. He left the office in 23 July 2016.
His publications include "The Twilight Zones in The Aegean (Un)Forgetten Turkish Islands", "Ege'de Temel Sorun: Egemenliği Tartışmalı Adalar", "Deniz Subayları için Temel Deniz Hukuku", "Montrö Sözleşmesi", "Türk Boğazları ve Karadeniz". He speaks English.
